{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms and history suggest pesticide poisoning, specifically from sodium fluoroacetate. Sodium fluoroacetate is known to form fluorocitrate in the cells of aerobic organisms. Fluorocitrate is an inhibitor of aconitase, an enzyme involved in the citric acid cycle. As a result, citrate will accumulate in the patient's cells.", "answer_choice": "B. Citrate"}
